segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Reset account lockout counter after security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Reset account lockout counter after security policy setting.

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Reset account lockout counter after security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Reset account lockout counter after security policy setting.

segment.source: The Reset account lockout counter after policy setting determines the number of minutes that must elapse from the time a user fails to log on before the failed logon attempt counter is reset to 0.
segment.target: The Reset account lockout counter after policy setting determines the number of minutes that must elapse from the time a user fails to log on before the failed logon attempt counter is reset to 0.

segment.source: If Account lockout threshold is set to a number greater than zero, this reset time must be less than or equal to the value of Account lockout duration.
segment.target: If Account lockout threshold is set to a number greater than zero, this reset time must be less than or equal to the value of Account lockout duration.

segment.source: A disadvantage to setting this too high is that users lock themselves out for an inconveniently long period if they exceed the account lockout threshold through logon errors.
segment.target: A disadvantage to setting this too high is that users lock themselves out for an inconveniently long period if they exceed the account lockout threshold through logon errors.

segment.source: Users may make excessive Help Desk calls.
segment.target: Users may make excessive Help Desk calls.

segment.source: A user-defined number of minutes from 1 through 99,999
segment.target: A user-defined number of minutes from 1 through 99,999

segment.source: You need to determine the threat level for your organization and balance that against the cost of your Help Desk support for password resets.
segment.target: You need to determine the threat level for your organization and balance that against the cost of your Help Desk support for password resets.

segment.source: Each organization will have specific requirements.
segment.target: Each organization will have specific requirements.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsAccount PoliciesAccount Lockout Policy
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsAccount PoliciesAccount Lockout Policy

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: Server type or Group Policy Object (GPO)
segment.target: Server type or Group Policy Object (GPO)

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Users can accidentally lock themselves out of their accounts if they mistype their password multiple times.
segment.target: Users can accidentally lock themselves out of their accounts if they mistype their password multiple times.

segment.source: Configure the Reset account lockout counter after policy setting to 30.
segment.target: Configure the Reset account lockout counter after policy setting to 30.

segment.source: If you do not configure this policy setting or if the value is configured to an interval that is too long, an attacker could attempt to log on to each user's account numerous times and lock out their accounts, a denial-of-service (DoS) attack might succeed, or administrators might have to manually unlock all locked-out accounts.
segment.target: If you do not configure this policy setting or if the value is configured to an interval that is too long, an attacker could attempt to log on to each user's account numerous times and lock out their accounts, a denial-of-service (DoS) attack might succeed, or administrators might have to manually unlock all locked-out accounts.

segment.source: If you configure this policy setting to a reasonable value, users can perform new attempts to log on after a failed logon within a reasonable time, without making brute force attacks feasible at high speeds.
segment.target: If you configure this policy setting to a reasonable value, users can perform new attempts to log on after a failed logon within a reasonable time, without making brute force attacks feasible at high speeds.

segment.source: Be sure that you notify users of the values that are used for this policy setting so that they wait for the lockout timer to expire before they call the Help Desk.
segment.target: Be sure that you notify users of the values that are used for this policy setting so that they wait for the lockout timer to expire before they call the Help Desk.
